modules.description: Handles incoming HTTP/1.1 connections on a Unix domain socket or TCP socket. It creates a connection handler that processes requests and errors using provided callbacks, working with socket addresses and file descriptors. Useful for building custom HTTP servers that interface directly with system sockets.

This module sends HTTP/1.1 requests over a pre-established connection and streams the response. It handles low-level I/O operations for clients, including writing request headers and body, and reading responses. Concrete use cases include implementing custom HTTP clients, streaming large responses, and integrating with existing network connections.

This module implements HTTP/1.1 client and server communication over Unix domain sockets or TCP. The Server module accepts connections, processes requests, and handles errors using callbacks, while the Client module sends requests and streams responses over existing connections. It is used to build lightweight, custom HTTP services and clients that directly manage socket-level I/O.
